fields.title: FAQ
fields.subtitle: Question 1
fields.question: What makes a katana different from other swords?
fields.answer: A katana is distinguished by its curved, slender, single-edged blade, crafted using specialized folding and differential hardening techniques. This process creates a unique grain pattern (hada) and temper line (hamon), resulting in a blade that is both sharp and resilient.

fields.title: FAQ
fields.subtitle: Question 2
fields.question: What materials are used to make a katana?
fields.answer: We use high-quality tamahagane steel, produced through traditional smelting methods. The steel is folded multiple times to remove impurities and create the distinctive layered structure essential for strength and flexibility.

fields.title: FAQ
fields.subtitle: Question 3
fields.question: Can I customize the design of my katana?
fields.answer: Absolutely! We offer fully custom-made katanas where you can choose blade length, hamon style, fittings (tsuka, tsuba, saya), and decorative motifs to create a personalized sword that reflects your vision and style.

fields.title: FAQ
fields.subtitle: Question 4
fields.question: How long does it take to make a custom katana?
fields.answer: Crafting a custom katana typically takes several months, depending on the complexity of the design and the materials chosen. Each blade requires meticulous forging, tempering, polishing, and assembly to ensure the highest quality.

fields.title: FAQ
fields.subtitle: Question 5
fields.question: What is the significance of the hamon?
fields.answer: The hamon is the visible temper line created during differential hardening. It indicates the blade’s hardness and cutting edge quality and is also a unique artistic signature of each swordsmith’s skill.

fields.title: FAQ
fields.subtitle: Question 6
fields.question: Can I request historical or symbolic designs?
fields.answer: Yes, we specialize in incorporating traditional and symbolic motifs that honor samurai culture, family crests, or personal meanings into the sword’s fittings and decorations.

fields.title: FAQ
fields.subtitle: Question 7
fields.question: Are your katanas functional or purely decorative?
fields.answer: Our katanas are fully functional swords, crafted for martial arts, cutting practice, or collection. They balance aesthetics with performance and durability.

fields.title: FAQ
fields.subtitle: Question 8
fields.question: Do you provide authentication or certification with your swords?
fields.answer: Every katana we produce comes with a certificate of authenticity detailing the materials, techniques, and craftsmanship involved, ensuring provenance and value for collectors.

fields.title: FAQ
fields.subtitle: Question 9
fields.question: How should I care for and maintain my katana?
fields.answer: Proper care includes regular cleaning, oiling the blade to prevent rust, and storing it in a dry environment. We provide detailed maintenance instructions with every sword to help preserve its condition for generations.

fields.title: FAQ
fields.subtitle: Question 10
fields.question: Can I commission a replica of a historical katana?
fields.answer: Yes, we can create replicas based on historical references, respecting the original design while applying our expert craftsmanship to produce a faithful and high-quality sword.
